intro: Alguelaguen heteromorpha, commonly known as the variable spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves and distinctive cyathium inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
